intro: Lappula nuratavica, commonly known as narrowleaf lappula, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Chenopodiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that appear in clusters. The leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered with fine hairs. It thrives in dry, sandy or gravelly soils and is typically found in arid or semi-arid regions. This plant is often considered a weed in agricultural settings due to its rapid growth and adaptability.
